title: Volume of a solid with known cross-section

content.question: Let R be the region in the first quadrant bounded below by the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A1D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and above by the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt> <mi>x</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. R is the base of a solid whose cross sections perpendicular to the x-axis are squares. What is the volume of the solid?

topic.text: 8.7: Volumes with Cross Sections - Squares and Rectangles

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
